abstract: Olympic dressage horses are pampered by team of specialists and each has full-time, year-round groom, who is responsible for every aspect of its care; Legolas 92, horse on American team, is tended to by Eddie Garcia, who rarely leaves its side.

headline.print_headline: Human Athletes Should Be So Pampered
headline.main: In Olympic Dressage, an Effortless Performance Takes Hard Work

snippet: In the equestrian version of ballroom dancing, horses must appear relaxed. Companions known as grooms help keep them amiable, serving as valet, dietitian and constant guardian....
